name: Chicken Biryani
cooking: Saffron – a few strands (soaked in 2 tbsp warm milk) OR ½ tsp turmeric milk
Fried onions – ½ cup (optional, for garnish)
steps: Step 1: Marinate the Chicken (15 mins prep + 30 mins rest)
Step 5: Layer the Biryani (10 mins prep + 20 mins cook)
stepDetails: In a mixing bowl, add chicken + all marinade ingredients.
Mix well, cover, and let it rest 30 minutes minimum (better if 1 hour).
Boil 6 cups of water with whole spices + salt.
Add soaked rice and cook until 70% done (grains should break with little pressure).
Drain and keep aside.
Heat oil + ghee in a wide pan.
Fry sliced onions until golden brown and crisp.
Remove half for garnish; keep half in the pan.
In the same pan with fried onions, add the marinated chicken.
Cook on medium flame until chicken is 80% cooked and oil separates.
In a heavy-bottom pan, keep the chicken masala at the bottom.
Spread half of the parboiled rice on top.
Sprinkle mint + coriander leaves + fried onions + saffron milk.
Add remaining rice and repeat toppings.
Cover tightly with a lid (or seal with dough) and cook on dum (low flame) for 20 minutes.
Serving: Fluff rice gently with a fork.
Serve hot with raita (curd + onion + cucumber)

name: Duck Biryani
details: Duck meat – 1 kg (cut into medium pieces)
cooking: Onions – 4 large (thinly sliced, fried golden brown)
Whole spices (bay leaf, cloves, cinnamon, cardamom) – 1 set
stepDetails: Wash duck pieces and pat dry.
Mix with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder,
garam masala, lemon juice, and salt.
Marinate for at least 2 hours (overnight for best flavor).
Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 mins.
Boil water with bay leaf, cloves, cinnamon, cardamom, star anise, and salt.
Add soaked rice and cook until 70% done (grains should be firm).
Drain and set aside.
Heat oil + ghee in a large pot.
Add whole spices, then add onions and fry till golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté.
Add tomatoes, green chilies, mint, and coriander. Cook till the masala thickens.
Add marinated duck and cook until the meat is 80% cooked and the masala is well combined. (Duck takes longer than chicken, so cook on medium flame, adding a little water if needed).
In a heavy-bottomed pot, spread half of the duck masala.
Add a layer of cooked rice.
Sprinkle fried onions, mint, coriander, and a little ghee.
Repeat layers until rice and meat are finished.
Drizzle saffron milk (optional).
Seal the pot with foil or dough, cover with a tight lid.
Place on low flame (or tawa) for 25–30 mins.
Time Breakdown: Cooking Time: 1 hr 30 mins (Preparation: 30 mins | Cooking: 1 hr)
Serving: Serve hot with raita, boiled eggs, or salan.
This recipe serves 6 people generously.

name: Egg Biryani
details: Whole Spices – 1 bay leaf, 3 cloves, 2 cardamoms, 1 cinnamon stick, 1 star anise
Saffron strands (optional) – soaked in 2 tbsp warm milk
stepDetails: Boil eggs, peel, and lightly prick them with a fork (so spices absorb).
Heat 1 tsp oil in a pan, add a pinch of turmeric + chili powder, and shallow fry eggs until golden. Set aside.
Boil 6 cups of water with salt and whole spices (1 bay leaf, 2 cloves, 1 cardamom).
Add soaked rice and cook till 70% done. Drain and keep aside.
Heat oil + ghee in a deep pan.
Add whole spices (remaining cloves, cinnamon, star anise, cardamom).
Add onions and sauté till golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste + green chilies, fry 2 mins.
Add tomatoes, cook till mushy.
Add biryani masala, chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, and salt.
Add yogurt, cook 2 mins till oil separates.
Mix in mint + coriander leaves.
In the masala, place fried eggs.
Spread half-cooked rice evenly on top.
Sprinkle fried onions, mint, coriander, lemon juice, and saffron milk.
Cover tightly with a lid.
Cook on low flame for 20 mins (Dum method).
Serving: Serve hot with raita, boiled eggs, or salan.
This recipe serves 6 people generously.

name: Fish Biryani
details: Fish fillets – 500g (Seer fish/Kingfish/Salmon or any firm fish)
rice: Whole spices – 2 bay leaves, 4 cloves, 4 green cardamoms, 1-inch cinnamon, 1 star anise
stepDetails: Clean fish pieces and pat dry.
Mix yogurt, spices, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, and salt.
Coat the fish pieces well and let them marinate for 15–30 minutes.
Boil 6 cups of water with whole spices and salt.
Add soaked rice and cook until 70% done.
Drain and keep aside.
Heat oil in a pan.
Shallow fry the marinated fish pieces until golden (do not overcook).
Keep aside on a plate.
Heat oil + ghee in a wide pan.
Add onions, fry till golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste & green chilies → sauté.
Add chopped tomatoes, yogurt, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, mint, and coriander leaves.
Cook until the masala thickens and oil separates.
In a heavy-bottomed vessel, spread half of the cooked rice.
Add the masala, then layer the fried fish pieces.
Add the remaining rice on top.
Garnish with fried onions, mint, coriander, and 1 tsp ghee.
Cover tightly (use foil or dough to seal edges).
Cook on low flame for 15 minutes.
Switch off and rest for 10 minutes before serving.
Serving: Serves: 4 people
Best served with raita, boiled egg, and papad.

name: jackfruit Biryani
details: 2 cups Raw Jackfruit (Kathal) – peeled & cut into medium cubes
rice: Few strands of Saffron soaked in 2 tbsp warm milk (optional)
steps: Step 2: Preparing the Jackfruit Masala (20 min)
stepDetails: Boil 4 cups of water with bay leaf, cloves, cinnamon, cardamom & salt.
Add soaked rice & cook until 70% done (grains should still be firm).
Drain the rice & keep aside.
Heat oil in a pan, and add cumin seeds.
Add sliced onions & sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste & cook for 1 min.
Add tomatoes, chili, turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder & salt. Cook till the masala releases oil.
Add jackfruit pieces & mix well.
Stir in yogurt slowly, cook on low flame until jackfruit softens (10–12 min).
Sprinkle garam masala & add coriander + mint leaves.
In a heavy-bottomed pot, grease with ghee.
Spread one layer of jackfruit masala, then a layer of rice.
Repeat until all rice & masala are used (finish with rice on top).
Sprinkle saffron milk, fried onions, cashews & ghee on top.
Cover tightly (use foil or dough to seal lid) & cook on low heat (dum) for 15 minutes.
Time Breakdown: Total Time: 1 hour (Prep: 20 min, Cooking: 40 min)
Serving: Fluff gently with a fork before serving.
Serve hot with raita, salad & papad.

name: keema Biryani
rice: Saffron strands soaked in 2 tbsp warm milk (optional)
steps: Step 2: Cook the Keema Masala (20 min)
stepDetails: Boil 5 cups of water with spices (shah jeera, cloves, cardamom, cinnamon, bay leaf, and salt).
Add soaked rice and cook until 70% done (grains should be slightly firm).
Drain and keep aside.
Heat oil/ghee in a pan. Fry onions till golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, sauté 1 min.
Add tomatoes, green chilies, and cook till soft.
Mix in keema (minced meat) and sauté on high flame for 5–7 mins until it changes color.
Add red chili, coriander, turmeric, cumin, pepper, and salt. Mix well.
Add yogurt, cook until oil separates.
Finish with garam masala, mint, and coriander.
In a heavy-bottomed pan, spread half of the keema masala.
Add a layer of rice on top.
Add fried onions, mint, coriander, and saffron milk
Repeat with the remaining keema masala and rice.
Cover tightly (seal with dough if possible).
Place the pan on a low flame, cook for 20 min.
Alternatively, keep on a tava (griddle) to avoid burning.
Time Breakdown: Total Time: 1 hour (Prep: 20 min | Cooking: 40 min)

name: Coin Parotta
details: Warm water – ¾ cup (adjust as needed)
stepDetails: In a mixing bowl, add maida, salt, sugar, and oil.
Add warm water little by little and knead into a soft, smooth dough (8–10 minutes).
Coat the dough with a little oil, cover, and rest for 20 minutes.
Divide the dough into 12 equal balls.
Place the balls in a tray, drizzle 2–3 tbsp oil over them, and coat well
Cover and let them rest for 45 minutes (this makes them easy to stretch).
Take one ball, keep the rest covered in oil.
On a greased surface, stretch it very thin (like a handkerchief).
Brush a little oil and sprinkle a pinch of dry flour over it.
Fold into pleats (like a ribbon) and then coil it into a small bun.
Tuck the end under the coil. Repeat for all balls.
Take each coiled bun and gently roll into a small thick disc (7–8 cm, coin size).
Do not press too thin — the layers should remain.
cooking: Heat a tawa on medium flame.
Place one coin parotta, cook for 1–1½ minutes on one side until light brown spots appear.
Flip, drizzle oil/ghee around the edges, cook another 1–1½ minutes.
Flip again for 20–30 seconds if needed.
Remove and clap gently between palms (or crush the sides with tongs) to open the flaky layers.
Time Breakdown: Total Time: 1 hour (Prep: 20 min | Cooking: 40 min)
Serving: Best served with Chicken Salna, Veg Kurma, Paneer Butter Masala, or Mutton Curry.
Also goes great with just pickle + raita for a simple combo.

name: Veechu Parotta
details: Warm water – ¾ cup (adjust as needed)
stepDetails: In a mixing bowl, combine maida, salt, sugar, and oil.
Gradually add warm water and knead into a soft, smooth dough (8–10 minutes).
Coat the dough with oil, cover, and rest for 20 minutes.
Divide dough into 8–10 equal balls.
Place balls in a tray, pour 2–3 tbsp oil over them, and coat well.
Cover and rest for 45 minutes to 1 hour (this makes the dough elastic and easy to stretch).
Grease your hands and work on a lightly oiled surface.
Take one ball (keep the rest covered in oil).
Stretch it into a large thin sheet – almost transparent
Sprinkle a little oil or dry flour on the stretched sheet.
Fold the sides into a square shape (like folding a letter/envelope).
Press gently to hold the layers together.
Cooking: Heat a tawa on medium flame.
Place the folded veechu parotta, cook for 1–1½ minutes on one side until light brown.
Flip, drizzle oil/ghee around the edges, cook another 1–1½ minutes.
Flip again for 20–30 seconds if needed.
Serving: Traditionally served with Salna (street-style curry), chicken/mutton kurma, or egg curry.
Also pairs well with spicy chutney or just pickle + curd.

name: Romali Parotta
details: Warm water – ¾ cup (adjust as needed)
cooking: Heat a tawa on medium flame.
Place one coin parotta, cook for 1–1½ minutes on one side until light brown spots appear.
Flip, drizzle oil/ghee around the edges, cook another 1–1½ minutes.
Flip again for 20–30 seconds if needed.
Remove and clap gently between palms (or crush the sides with tongs) to open the flaky layers.
steps: Step 1: Prepare the Dough (10 min + 20 min rest)
stepDetails: Mix maida, salt, sugar, and oil in a bowl.
Gradually add warm water, kneading for 8–10 minutes until soft and smooth.
Coat the dough lightly with oil, cover, and let it rest 20 minutes.
Divide the dough into 8–10 equal balls.
Coat each ball with oil, place it in a tray, and cover.
Let rest 45–60 minutes for elasticity.
Lightly grease hands and rolling surface.
Take one ball, roll/stretch it into a thin, large circle or oval.
Dust with flour if it sticks.
Serving: Serve hot with curries, kebabs, biryani, or tandoori dishes
Can also be used as a wrap/roll with vegetables or meats.

name: Nool Parotta
stepDetails: Mix maida, salt, sugar, and oil in a bowl.
Add water little by little and knead into a soft, smooth dough (8–10 minutes).
Add 1 tbsp oil and knead again.
Coat with oil, cover, and rest for 30 minutes.
Divide the dough into equal lemon-sized balls.
Roll out each ball into a very thin sheet (as thin as possible).
Brush lightly with oil and dust with rice flour.
Cut the sheet into long thin strips using a knife/pizza cutter.
Gather strips loosely and roll into a spiral bun (like a coil).
Rest spirals for 15 minutes (covered).
Take one spiral, flatten gently with a rolling pin.
Roll into a medium-thick round parotta (do not press too hard, to keep strings visible).
cooking: Heat a tawa on medium flame.
Place one coin parotta, cook for 1–1½ minutes on one side until light brown spots appear.
Flip, drizzle oil/ghee around the edges, cook another 1–1½ minutes.
Flip again for 20–30 seconds if needed.
Remove and clap gently between palms (or crush the sides with tongs) to open the flaky layers.
Serving: Serve hot with curries, kebabs, biryani, or tandoori dishes
Can also be used as a wrap/roll with vegetables or meats.

name: Kizhi Parotta
details: Fried chicken pieces / mutton chukka – few
stepDetails: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a kadai.
Add onion, green chilies, curry leaves – sauté till golden.
Add ginger garlic paste – cook till raw smell disappears.
Add tomato and cook till mushy.
Add chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt – mix well.
Pour in chicken/mutton curry (salna) and simmer for 10 minutes till thick.
Finish with chopped coriander leaves.
Place banana leaf (softened over flame) on a flat surface.
Place 1 parotta, spread little curry over it.
Add another parotta, then more curry, repeat layering.
Add optional egg or fried meat pieces on top.
Pour extra curry over the top.
Wrap the banana leaf tightly into a parcel (like a kizhi/pocket).
Tie with cotton string if needed.
Place wrapped banana leaf parcels in an idli steamer / pressure cooker (without whistle).
Steam for 10–12 minutes until flavors infuse.
Remove carefully, unwrap, and serve hot.
Serving: Traditionally served with raita, onion slices, or extra salna.
The steamed banana leaf gives a unique aroma and taste.

name: Chicken Kothu Parotta
details: Salna / Chicken curry – ½ cup (for authentic flavor)
stepDetails: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a kadai.
Add onion, green chilies, curry leaves – sauté till golden.
Add ginger garlic paste – cook till raw smell disappears.
Add tomato and cook till mushy.
Add chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt – mix well.
Cook for 10 minutes until chicken is soft.
Add ½ cup salna/chicken curry for moisture (or little water).
Push chicken masala to one side of the pan.
Add 2 beaten eggs, scramble them, and mix into the masala.
Add torn parotta pieces into the chicken masala.
Pour in some more salna/chicken curry (½ cup) to soften parotta.
Using two spatulas, cut and toss continuously (like street vendors do) until parotta absorbs masala.
Cook for 5–7 minutes on medium flame until parotta becomes soft and coated well.
Serving: Sprinkle coriander leaves.
Serve hot with onion raita or extra salna on the side.

name: Kadai Semi-gravy
stepDetails: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a kadai.
Add onion, green chilies, curry leaves – sauté till golden.
Add ginger garlic paste – cook till raw smell disappears.
Add tomato and cook till mushy.
Add chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt – mix well.
Cook for 10 minutes until chicken is soft.
Add ½ cup salna/chicken curry for moisture (or little water).
Push chicken masala to one side of the pan.
Add 2 beaten eggs, scramble them, and mix into the masala.
Add torn parotta pieces into the chicken masala.
Pour in some more salna/chicken curry (½ cup) to soften parotta.
Using two spatulas, cut and toss continuously (like street vendors do) until parotta absorbs masala.
Cook for 5–7 minutes on medium flame until parotta becomes soft and coated well.
Serving: Sprinkle coriander leaves.
Serve hot with onion raita or extra salna on the side.

name: Mutton Sukka Semi-Gravy
details: Fresh coconut (grated) – 2 tbsp (lightly roasted & ground, optional)
steps: Step 4:  Add Cooked Mutton & Reduce (12 mins)
stepDetails: Wash mutton and add to pressure cooker.
Add ½ tsp turmeric, salt, and 1 cup water
Pressure cook for 6–7 whistles or until soft (20–25 minutes).
Heat oil in a kadai.
Add onions + curry leaves → sauté till golden brown (6 minutes).
Add ginger-garlic paste + green chilies → fry till raw smell goes (1 minute).
Add chopped tomatoes + salt → cook till mushy (5 minutes).
Add red chili powder, coriander powder → fry masala well (3 minutes).
Add the cooked mutton with stock into masala.
Mix well and simmer until gravy thickens and coats the meat (10–12 minutes).
Add pepper powder + garam masala → stir well (2 minutes).
Optionally, add roasted coconut paste for extra flavor (2–3 minutes).
Serving: Sprinkle fresh coriander leaves.
Switch off and rest for a minute.

name: Prawn Masala Semi-Gravy
stepDetails: Wash prawns well and drain.
Marinate with ½ tsp turmeric + ½ tsp chili powder + salt.
Rest for 10 minutes.
Heat oil in a kadai.
Add onions + curry leaves → sauté until golden (5 minutes).
Add ginger garlic paste + green chilies → fry until raw smell leaves (1 minute).
Add chopped tomatoes + salt → cook until mushy (5 minutes).
Add red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric → sauté well (2 minutes).
Add marinated prawns → mix with masala (1 minute).
Add ½ cup water → cook on medium flame until prawns turn pink & soft (5–6 minutes).
Do not overcook, prawns turn rubbery.
Add pepper powder + garam masala → stir well (2 minutes).
Serving: Sprinkle fresh coriander leaves.
Rest for a minute before serving.

name: Fish Fry Masala Semi-Gravy
details: Fish slices – 500 g (Seer fish/King fish/Pomfret works best)
steps: Step 4:  Add Water & Thicken Masala (6 mins)
stepDetails: Clean fish pieces and marinate with red chili powder, turmeric, lemon juice, salt → rest 15 minutes.
Heat oil → shallow fry fish till golden on both sides (5 minutes per side).Set aside.
In another kadai, heat oil.
Add onions + curry leaves → sauté until golden (6 minutes).
Add ginger garlic paste + green chilies → fry till raw smell goes (1 minute).
Add tomatoes + salt → cook till mushy (5 minutes).
Add red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric → fry well (3 minutes).
Add ½ cup water → cook till masala thickens and oil starts separating (6 minutes).
Gently place fried fish into the masala → coat well (3 minutes).
Add pepper powder + garam masala → mix carefully without breaking fish (2 minutes).
Serving: Sprinkle coriander leaves.
Rest for a minute to let flavors settle.

name: Crab Masala Semi-Gravy
details: Crab – 500 g (cleaned and cut into pieces)
Fresh coconut paste – 2 tbsp (optional, for richness)
stepDetails: Wash crabs and cut into pieces.
Marinate with ½ tsp turmeric + ½ tsp chili powder + salt → rest for 10 minutes.
Add onions + curry leaves → sauté until golden brown (6 minutes).
Add ginger garlic paste + green chilies → fry until raw smell goes (1 minute).
Add tomatoes + salt → cook until mushy (5 minutes).
Add red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric → sauté well (3 minutes).
Add marinated crab pieces → mix gently with masala (2 minutes).
Add ½–1 cup water → cover and simmer on medium flame until crab is cooked and masala reduces to semi-thick consistency (10–13 minutes).
Add pepper powder + garam masala → stir gently (2 minutes).
Serving: Sprinkle fresh coriander leaves.
Rest for 1 minute before serving.

name: Squid Masala Semi-Gravy
details: Black pepper powder – 1 tsp (freshly ground for best flavor)
Fresh coconut paste – 2 tbsp (optional, for richness)
steps: Step 4:  Add Squid & Cook Semi-Gravy (6–7 mins)
Step 5:  Finish with Pepper & Masala (3 mins)
stepDetails: Wash squid rings thoroughly and drain.
Marinate with ½ tsp turmeric + ½ tsp chili powder + salt → rest for 5–7 minutes.
Heat oil in a kadai.
Add onions + curry leaves → sauté until golden (5 minutes).
Add ginger garlic paste + green chilies → fry until raw smell disappears (1 minute).
Add tomatoes + salt → cook till mushy (5 minutes).
Add red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric → sauté well (2 minutes).
Add marinated squid rings → mix gently with masala (1 minute).
Add ½ cup water → cook on medium flame until squid turns tender but not rubbery and masala thickens slightly (5–6 minutes).
Add black pepper powder + garam masala → mix gently (2 minutes).
Optional: add coconut paste → cook 1 minute for extra richness.
Serving: Sprinkle fresh coriander leaves.
Let rest for a minute before serving.

name: Paneer Fry fry-items
details: Fresh coriander leaves – 1 tbsp (chopped, for garnish)
stepDetails: In a bowl, mix paneer cubes + ginger garlic paste + red chili powder + turmeric + garam masala + corn flour + all-purpose flour + salt + lemon juice.
Coat paneer evenly and rest for 10 minutes.
Heat oil in a frying pan or kadai for shallow or deep frying.
Add marinated paneer cubes carefully to hot oil.
Fry until golden brown and crispy on all sides (3–4 minutes per batch).
Remove and drain excess oil on paper towels.
Serving: Sprinkle fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Gobi 65 fry-items
details: Boil water in a pan, add florets with ½ tsp salt, blanch for 2–3 minutes.
In a bowl, mix cauliflower florets + ginger garlic paste + red chili powder + turmeric + coriander powder + garam masala + corn flour + all-purpose flour + rice flour + salt + lemon juice.
Coat evenly and rest for 10 minutes.
Heat oil in a deep frying pan or kadai until hot.
Add marinated florets carefully into hot oil.
Fry in batches until golden brown and crispy (4–5 minutes per batch).
Remove and drain excess oil on paper towels.
stepDetails: Cauliflower – 1 medium head (cut into florets)
Ginger garlic paste – 1 tsp
Red chili powder – 1½ tsp
Turmeric powder – ½ tsp
Coriander powder – 1 tsp
Garam masala – ½ tsp
Corn flour – 2 tbsp
All-purpose flour – 2 tbsp
Rice flour – 1 tbsp (for extra crispiness)
Salt – as needed
Lemon juice – 1 tsp
Curry leaves – 1 sprig (for garnish)
Oil – for deep frying
Serving: Toss fried cauliflower with fresh curry leaves.
Serve hot as a starter or side dish.

name: French Fries fry-items
details: Potatoes – 3 large (peeled and cut into thin sticks)
Red chili powder – ¼ tsp (optional, for spice)
stepDetails: After cutting potatoes into sticks, soak them in cold water for 15 minutes.
This removes excess starch and prevents sticking.
Boil water in a pan.
Blanch potato sticks for 2–3 minutes → drain and pat dry with a kitchen towel.
Heat oil in a deep frying pan or kadai on medium-high flame until hot (around 180°C / 350°F).
Fry potato sticks in batches until light golden (3–4 minutes per batch).
Remove and drain on paper towels.
Increase oil temperature slightly.
Fry potato sticks again until golden brown and crispy (2–3 minutes per batch).
Remove and drain excess oil.
Serving: Sprinkle salt + black pepper + red chili powder (optional).
Serve immediately with ketchup or mayonnaise.

name: Honey Chilli Potato Fry-items
details: Potatoes – 3 large (peeled and cut into thin sticks)
Red chili sauce – 1 tsp (adjust to taste)
steps: Step 5:   Toss Potatoes in Sauce (2 mins)
stepDetails: Cut potatoes into thin stick
Soak in cold water for 15 minutes to remove starch.
Drain and pat dry completely.
In a bowl, mix cornstarch + all-purpose flour + salt.
Toss potato sticks in the mixture until evenly coated.
Heat oil in a deep frying pan until hot.
Fry coated potatoes in batches until golden and crispy (4–5 minutes per batch).
Remove and drain on paper towels
Heat 1–2 tsp oil in a pan.
Add chopped garlic + slit green chilies → sauté 30 seconds.
Add soy sauce + tomato ketchup + red chili sauce + honey → mix well and simmer for 1–2 minutes.
Add fried potatoes to the sauce → toss gently until well coated.

name: Seer Fish fry-items
details: Seer fish (Surmai/Kingfish) – 500 g (cut into steaks or pieces)
stepDetails: Clean fish pieces thoroughly.
Marinate with ginger garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, black pepper powder, lemon juice, salt, and rice flour.
Rest for 15 minutes.
Heat oil in a frying pan or kadai for shallow or deep frying.
Carefully add marinated fish pieces to hot oil.
Fry until golden brown and cooked through, flipping once (4–5 minutes per side).
Remove and drain excess oil on paper towels.
Serving: Garnish with curry leaves (optional).

name: Nethili Fish fry-items
steps: Step 3:  Marinate the Fish (20 mins resting time)
stepDetails: Wash the anchovies thoroughly in running water.
Remove head and guts, drain excess water.
Mix ginger-garlic paste, chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, pepper powder, lemon juice, salt, and rice flour.
Add little water to form a thick paste.
Coat the cleaned anchovies with the masala paste.
Rest for 20 minutes to absorb flavors.
Pour oil in a frying pan and heat on medium flame.
Drop the marinated anchovies in small batches into hot oil.
Fry until golden brown and crispy.
Drain on paper towels.
Serving: Fry some curry leaves in the same oil until crisp and use them as garnish.

name: Margherita Pizza
details: Tomato sauce / Pizza sauce – ½ cup
Fresh mozzarella cheese – 150 g (sliced or grated)
steps: Step 1:  Prepare the Dough (if homemade) – 15 mins + 1 hr resting
stepDetails: Mix flour, yeast, salt, sugar, olive oil, and warm water
Knead for 10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Rest covered for 1 hour until it doubles in size.
Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F)
Place pizza stone or tray inside while preheating
Roll out the dough into a thin round base (10–12 inch).
Place on parchment paper or a greased tray.
Spread tomato/pizza sauce evenly over the base.
Leave a little border for the crust.
Place mozzarella slices or grated cheese on top.
Add fresh basil leaves.
Drizzle olive oil lightly.
Place pizza in preheated oven.
Bake until the cheese melts and crust turns golden brown.
Serving: Remove from oven.
Cool for 2 minutes, slice, and serve hot

name: Chicken Tikka Pizza
details: Boneless chicken – 200 g (cut into bite-size pieces)
steps: Step 1:  Prepare Pizza Dough (15 mins active + 1 hr resting = 1 hr 15 mins)
Step 2:  Marinate Chicken Tikka (10 mins + 30 mins resting = 40 mins)
Step 3:  Cook the Chicken Tikka (10 mins)
stepDetails: Mix yeast, sugar, and warm water; rest 10 mins until frothy.
Add flour, salt, olive oil, and knead into a soft dough (~10 mins).
Cover and rest for 1 hour until it doubles in size.
In a bowl, mix curd, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, lemon juice, salt, and oil.
Add chicken pieces, coat well, and rest for 30 mins.
Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F).
Roll out dough into a round base (~½ inch thick).
Place on a greased baking tray.
Spread pizza sauce evenly.
Sprinkle half of the mozzarella cheese.
Arrange onions, capsicum, green chili, and cooked chicken tikka.
Top with remaining cheese.
Bake at 220°C until cheese melts and turns golden.
Time Breakdown: 2 hrs 30 mins (including dough resting and chicken marination)
Serving: Bake at 220°C until cheese melts and turns golden.
Slice and serve hot.

name: Garlic Mushroom Pizza
details: Parsley or coriander leaves – few (for garnish)
steps: Step 1:  Prepare Pizza Dough (15 mins active + 1 hr resting = 1 hr 15 mins):
stepDetails: Mix yeast, sugar, and warm water; rest 10 mins until frothy.
Add flour, salt, and olive oil; knead for ~10 mins until smooth.
Cover and rest 1 hour until dough doubles in size.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a pan.
Sauté mushrooms on medium flame until moisture evaporates (~5 mins).
Add minced garlic, salt, and black pepper; cook 1–2 mins.
Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F).
Roll out the risen dough into a round base (~½ inch thick).
Place on a greased baking tray or parchment paper.
Brush base lightly with olive oil.
Sprinkle half of the mozzarella cheese.
Spread sautéed garlic mushrooms evenly.
Add optional onions/capsicum if using.
Top with remaining cheese.
Bake at 220°C until the cheese melts and the edges turn golden brown.
Time Breakdown: 2 hrs 10–15 mins (including dough resting and mushroom prep)
Serving: Sprinkle chopped parsley or coriander.

name: Italian Garden Pizza
details: Crushed tomatoes / tomato purée – 1 cup (250 g)
Dried basil – 1 tsp (or 6–8 fresh leaves, torn, at the end)
Bell peppers (mixed colours) – ½ cup, thin strips
Red onion – ¼ cup, thin slices
Mushrooms – ¼ cup, thinly sliced (optional: pre-sauté 2–3 min)
Pinch of dried oregano or Italian seasoning
steps: Step 1:  Start the dough – 15 min active
Step 3:  (During the rise: make sauce & prep veg – overlaps time)3) Quick sauce – 12–15 min active (overlaps rise)
Step 4:  Prep toppings – 10 min active (overlaps rise)
stepDetails: In a bowl, mix warm water, sugar, and yeast. Rest 5 min until foamy.
Add flour, salt, and olive oil. Mix, then knead 8–10 min until smooth and springy.
Lightly oil a bowl, place dough, cover.
Let the dough double in size (warm spot).
Let the dough double in size (warm spot).
Warm olive oil in a pan, sauté garlic 30 sec.
Add tomatoes, oregano, basil, chilli flakes, salt, pepper.
Simmer on low 10–12 min until slightly thick. Cool.
Slice veggies thin; pat dry (reduces sogginess).
Serving: Out of the oven: add fresh basil, a tiny drizzle of EVOO, crack of black pepper. Rest 1–2 min, slice, serve.

name: Cheese Burst Pizza
details: Crushed tomatoes / tomato purée – 1 cup (250 g)
Dried basil – 1 tsp (or 6–8 fresh leaves, torn at the end)
Bell peppers (any colour) – ½ cup, thin strips
Red onion – ¼ cup, thin slices
Mushrooms – ¼ cup, thin slices (optional sauté)
Pinch of dried oregano or Italian seasoning
steps: Step 1:  Start the dough – 15 min active
Step 3:  Quick sauce – 12–15 min active (overlaps rise)
Step 4:  Cheese burst filling – 5 min active
Step 5:  Shape with cheese burst layer – 10 min active
stepDetails: Mix warm water, sugar, and yeast. Rest 5 min until foamy.
Add flour, salt, and olive oil. Knead 8–10 min until soft & slightly sticky (not dry).
Oil a bowl, place dough, cover.
Let dough double in size in a warm spot.
Heat olive oil, sauté garlic 30 sec.
Add tomatoes, oregano, basil, chilli flakes, salt, pepper.
Simmer 10–12 min until thick. Cool.
In a small pan, melt processed cheese with ¼ cup warm milk until smooth.
Cool slightly – this will be spread between two layers of dough.
Punch down dough. Divide into 2 portions: ⅔ and ⅓.
Roll larger portion to 11–12 in (28–30 cm). Place on parchment.
Spread cheese burst filling in the center, leaving 1.5 in border.
Roll smaller portion slightly thinner, ~9–10 in, place over filling.
Seal edges well by pinching, then flatten lightly with hands.
Now roll gently again to even thickness (~6 mm).
Serving: the cheese burst flow out!

name: Mexican Veg Pizza
details: Tomato purée / crushed tomatoes – 1 cup (250 g)
Red chilli powder / paprika – ½ tsp
Bell peppers (red, yellow, green) – ½ cup, strips
Red onion – ¼ cup, thin slices
Cooked red kidney beans (rajma) – 2 tbsp (optional, for Mexican touch)
Pinch of Mexican seasoning / oregano + chilli flakes
steps: Step 1:  Start the dough – 15 min active
Step 3:  Make Mexican sauce – 12–15 min active (overlaps rise)
Step 4:  Prep toppings – 10 min active (overlaps rise)
stepDetails: Mix warm water, sugar, yeast. Rest 5 min until foamy.
Add flour, salt, olive oil. Knead 8–10 min until soft.
Oil a bowl, place dough, cover.
Let dough double in size in a warm spot.
Heat olive oil, sauté garlic & onion 1–2 min
Add tomato purée, paprika, cumin, oregano, basil, salt, pepper.
Simmer 10 min until thick & flavorful. Stir in hot sauce if using.
Boil corn, slice veggies, prep jalapeños/beans. Pat dry to reduce sogginess.
Preheat oven to 250°C / 475°F with a pizza stone or inverted tray inside.
Punch down dough. Roll to 11–12 in (28–30 cm), ~5–6 mm thick.
Serving: Out of oven: garnish with fresh coriander, extra drizzle of EVOO, crack of pepper. Rest 1–2 min, slice & serve!

name: Classic Chicken Burger
details: Boneless chicken – 200 g (minced or finely chopped)
steps: Step 1:  Prepare Chicken Patty (10 mins prep + 10 mins cooking = 20 mins):
stepDetails: Mix minced chicken, bread crumbs, egg, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Shape into round patties (~2 cm thick).
Heat oil in a pan on medium flame and shallow fry patties for 5–6 mins per side until golden and cooked.
Slice buns in half and lightly toast on a pan until slightly golden.
Spread mayonnaise and ketchup on bottom bun.
Place lettuce leaf, tomato slice, onion slice, and cooked chicken patty.
Add a cheese slice on top.
Cover with top bun.
Serving: Serve hot with French fries or potato wedges.

name: Veggie Burger
steps: Step 1:  Prepare Veggie Patty (10 mins prep + 8–10 mins cooking = 18–20 mins):
stepDetails: In a bowl, mix mashed potatoes, grated carrot, chopped beans, sweet corn, bread crumbs, salt, pepper, and chili powder.
Shape mixture into round patties (~2 cm thick).
Heat oil in a pan on medium flame and shallow fry patties for 4–5 mins per side until golden and firm.
Slice buns in half and lightly toast on a pan until slightly golden.
Spread mayonnaise and ketchup on bottom bun.
Place lettuce leaf, tomato slice, onion slice, and cooked veggie patty.
Add a cheese slice on top.
Serving: Serve hot with French fries or potato wedges.

name: Cheese Burst Burger
details: Boneless chicken – 200 g (minced), Bread crumbs – 3 tbsp, Egg – 1, Ginger-garlic paste – 1 tsp, Salt – to taste, Black pepper – ¼ tsp, Oil – 1 tbsp
steps: Step 1:  Prepare Burger Patty (10 mins prep + 8–10 mins cooking = 18–20 mins):
stepDetails: Mix minced chicken, bread crumbs, egg, ginger-garlic paste, salt, and pepper.Shape the mixture into round patties.
Make a small cavity in the center of each patty, place mozzarella cubes inside, and seal carefully.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry patties for 4–5 mins per side until golden and cooked through.
Slice buns in half and lightly toast on a pan until slightly golden.
Spread mayonnaise and ketchup on bottom bun.
Place lettuce leaf, tomato slice, onion slice, and cooked cheese burst patty.
Add extra mozzarella on top if desired.
Serving: Serve hot, with fries or potato wedges, so the melted cheese bursts on biting.

name: Paneer Tikka Burger
steps: Step 1:  Marinate Paneer (5–10 mins prep + 20–30 mins resting = 25–40 mins):
stepDetails: In a bowl, mix curd, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, lemon juice, salt, and oil.
Toss paneer cubes in the mixture and let them marinate for 20–30 mins.
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan.
Sauté marinated paneer cubes until lightly browned on all sides.
Slice buns in half and lightly toast on a pan until golden.
Spread mayonnaise and green chutney (if using) on the bottom bun.
Place lettuce leaf, tomato slice, onion slice, and cooked paneer cubes.
Add a cheese slice on top.
Cover with the top bun.
Serving: Serve hot with French fries, potato wedges, or a dipping sauce.

name: Crispy Veg Burger
steps: Step 1:  Prepare Veg Patty (10 mins prep + 5–6 mins cooking = 16 mins):
Step 2:  Coat Patties for Crispiness (5 mins):
stepDetails: In a bowl, mix mashed potatoes, grated carrot, boiled peas, corn, bread crumbs, salt, black pepper, and chili powder.
Shape mixture into round patties (~2 cm thick).
Dredge patties in flour, dip in beaten egg (or flour-water mix for vegan), and coat with bread crumbs.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry patties until golden brown and crispy (4–5 mins per side).
Slice buns in half and lightly toast on a pan until golden.
Spread mayonnaise and ketchup on the bottom bun.
Place lettuce, tomato slice, onion slice, and crispy veg patty.
Add cheese slice on top (optional).
Serving: Serve hot with French fries, potato wedges, or a dipping sauce.

name: Double Patty Burger
steps: Step 1:  Prepare Veg Patty Mixture (12 mins prep + 6 mins cooking = 18 mins):
Step 2:  Coat Patties for Crispiness (6 mins):
Step 5:  Assemble Double Patty Burger (7–8 mins):
stepDetails: In a bowl, mix mashed potatoes, grated carrot, boiled peas, corn, bread crumbs, salt, black pepper, and chili powder.
Dredge patties in flour, dip in beaten egg (or flour-water mix), and coat with bread crumbs.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry all patties until golden and crispy (4–5 mins per side).
Slice buns in half and lightly toast them on a pan until golden.
Spread mayonnaise + ketchup on the bottom bun.
Add lettuce, tomato, onion slice.
Place 1 crispy patty.
Add cheese slice
Place second patty on top.
Add more onion/tomato/lettuce if desired.
Serving: Serve hot with French fries, wedges,

name: Vanilla Ice Cream
steps: Step 2:  Whisk Egg Yolks & Sugar (2 mins):
stepDetails: In a pan, heat milk and cream on medium flame until warm (do not boil).
In a separate bowl, whisk egg yolks and sugar until pale and creamy.
Slowly pour warm milk mixture into the egg yolks while whisking continuously to prevent curdling
Return the mixture to the pan and cook on low flame, stirring continuously until it thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon.
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract.
Allow the custard to cool to room temperature, then refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Pour the custard into an ice cream maker or a freezer-safe container.
Freeze until firm, stirring occasionally if not using a machine to avoid ice crystals
Serving: Scoop into bowls or cones and serve chilled.

name: Mango Ice Cream
steps: Step 3:  Mix Mango & Condensed Milk (2–3 mins):
stepDetails: Peel and chop ripe mangoes.
Blend into a smooth puree
In a bowl, whip heavy cream until soft peaks form.
Gently fold mango puree and sweetened condensed milk into whipped cream.
Mix until smooth and well combined.
Lightly refrigerate the mixture to remove any initial warmth.
Pour mixture into a freezer-safe container.
Cover and freeze until firm.
Stir gently every 2 hours if not using an ice cream maker to avoid ice crystals.
Serving: Scoop into bowls or cones.

name: Raspberry Ice Cream
details: Sugar – ¼ cup (adjust based on sweetness of raspberries)
steps: Step 3:  Mix Raspberry & Condensed Milk (2–3 mins):
stepDetails: Blend raspberries into a smooth puree.
Strain through a fine sieve to remove seeds (optional).
Add lemon juice if desired.
In a bowl, whip heavy cream until soft peaks form.
Gently fold raspberry puree and sweetened condensed milk into whipped cream.
Mix until smooth and fully combined.
Refrigerate the mixture for a few minutes to remove any initial warmth.
Pour mixture into a freezer-safe container.
Cover and freeze until firm.
Stir gently every 2 hours if not using an ice cream maker to avoid ice crystals.
Serving: Scoop into bowls or cones.

name: Macadamia Ice Cream
steps: Step 3:  Whisk Egg Yolks & Sugar (2 mins):
stepDetails: Heat a dry pan on medium flame.
Lightly toast chopped macadamia nuts until golden and fragrant.
In a pan, heat milk and cream on medium flame until warm (do not boil).
In a separate bowl, whisk egg yolks and sugar until pale and creamy.
Slowly pour warm milk mixture into the egg yolks while whisking continuously to prevent curdling.
Return the mixture to the pan and cook on low flame, stirring continuously until thickened enough to coat the back of a spoon.
Stir in vanilla extract and toasted macadamia nuts (reserve a few for garnish).
Allow custard to cool to room temperature, then refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Pour custard into an ice cream maker or a freezer-safe container.
Freeze until firm, stirring occasionally if not using a machine to avoid ice crystals.
Serving: Scoop into bowls or cones.

name: Bubblegum Ice Cream
details: Pink food coloring – a few drops (optional)
Small bubblegum pieces or candy bits – ¼ cup
steps: Step 2:  Mix Condensed Milk & Flavor (2–3 mins):
stepDetails: In a bowl, whip heavy cream until soft peaks form.
Gently fold in sweetened condensed milk, bubblegum flavoring, and pink food coloring (if using) into whipped cream.
Fold in small bubblegum pieces or candy bits gently.
Lightly refrigerate the mixture to remove any warmth.
Pour mixture into a freezer-safe container.
Cover and freeze until firm.
Stir gently every 2 hours if not using an ice cream maker to prevent ice crystals
Serving: Scoop into bowls or cones.

name: Red Velvet Cake
steps: Step 1:  Preheat Oven & Prepare Pans (10 mins):
Step 4:  Combine Wet & Dry Ingredients (3–4 mins):
Step 7:  Prepare Cream Cheese Frosting (10 mins):
stepDetails: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F).
Grease and line two 8-inch round cake pans.
In a bowl, sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk buttermilk, oil, eggs, red food coloring, vinegar, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Gradually add dry ingredients into wet mixture.
Mix gently until smooth, ensuring no lumps.
Divide batter evenly between prepared pans.
Bake at 175°C (350°F) for 25–30 mins or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Remove cakes from oven and let cool in pans for 10 mins.
Transfer to a wire rack and cool completely before frosting.
In a bowl, beat cream cheese and butter until smooth.
Add powdered sugar gradually and beat until creamy.
Stir in vanilla extract.
Place one cake layer on a serving plate.
Spread a layer of frosting evenly.
Place second cake layer on top and frost the entire cake.
Serving: Optionally, garnish with red crumbs or chocolate shavings.

name: Sponge Cake
steps: Step 1:  Preheat Oven & Prepare Pan (10 mins):
Step 5:  Add Milk, Butter & Vanilla (2–3 mins):
stepDetails: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Grease and line an 8-inch round cake pan.
In a large bowl, beat eggs and sugar until pale, fluffy, and doubled in volume.
Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together.
Gently fold dry ingredients into the egg-sugar mixture using a spatula.
Do not overmix to keep the batter airy.
Fold in warm milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract carefully.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 25–30 mins or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Remove from oven and cool in pan for 10 mins.
Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely before frosting or slicing.
Serving: Serve plain or decorate with whipped cream, fruits, or chocolate.

name: Almond Cake
details: Almond flour / ground almonds – ½ cup
steps: Step 1:  Preheat Oven & Prepare Pan (10 mins):
Step 4:  Add Eggs & Almond Extract (2–3 mins):
Step 5:  Combine Wet & Dry Ingredients (3–4 mins):
Step 6:  Pour Batter & Add Topping (2 mins):
stepDetails: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F).
Grease and line an 8-inch round cake pan.
In a bowl, sift together all-purpose flour, almond flour, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, beat softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time.
Add almond extract and mix well.
Gradually fold dry ingredients into wet mixture.
Add milk slowly to achieve smooth batter.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Sprinkle sliced almonds on top.
Bake at 175°C (350°F) for 30–35 mins or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let cake cool in pan for 10 mins.
Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Serving: Mix powdered sugar with a few drops of milk to make a glaze.

name: Black Forest Cake
details: Cherry jam or syrup – ½ cup
steps: Step 1:  Preheat Oven & Prepare Pans (10 mins):
Step 4:  Combine Wet & Dry Ingredients (2–3 mins):
stepDetails: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F).
Grease and line two 8-inch round cake pans.
In a bowl, sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk eggs, sugar, milk, oil, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Gradually fold dry ingredients into wet mixture.
Slowly add boiling water while mixing gently.
Divide batter evenly between prepared pans.
Bake at 175°C (350°F) for 25–30 mins or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Let cakes cool in pans for 10 mins.
Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Beat heavy cream, powdered sugar, and vanilla until soft peaks form.
Place one cake layer on a serving plate.
Spread a layer of cherry jam.
Add a layer of whipped cream and some maraschino cherries.
Place second cake layer on top.
Frost entire cake with remaining whipped cream.
Garnish with chocolate shavings and remaining cherries.
Serving: Slice and serve chilled.

name: Mocha Cake
details: Cocoa powder – 1 tbsp (optional for extra mocha flavor)
steps: Step 1:  Preheat Oven & Prepare Pan (10 mins):
Step 4:  Combine Wet & Dry Ingredients (2–3 mins):
stepDetails: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F).
Grease and line an 8-inch round or square cake pan.
In a bowl, sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk eggs, sugar, coffee, milk, oil, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Gradually fold dry ingredients into wet mixture.
Mix gently until smooth and lump-free.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake at 175°C (350°F) for 30–35 mins or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Let cake cool in pan for 10 mins.
Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Beat butter until creamy.
Gradually add powdered sugar and cocoa powder (if using).
Add coffee gradually and beat until smooth and fluffy.
Spread frosting evenly over cooled cake.
Optionally, layer cake with frosting if making a double-layer cake.
Serving: Decorate with chocolate shavings or coffee beans.

name: Rainbow Cake
details: Food coloring – Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Purple
steps: Step 1:  Preheat Oven & Prepare Pans (10 mins):
Step 4:  Combine Wet & Dry Ingredients (3 mins):
Step 5:  Divide Batter & Add Colors (5 mins):
Step 6:  Bake the Cakes (12–15 mins per layer):
Step 7:  Prepare Whipped Cream Frosting (5–6 mins):
stepDetails: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F).
Grease and line 6 small cake pans (or bake in batches if using fewer pans).
In a bowl, sift together flour, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk eggs, sugar, milk, oil, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Gradually fold dry ingredients into wet mixture until smooth and lump-free.
Divide batter equally into 6 bowls.
Add a few drops of each food coloring to each bowl to get Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, and Purple batter.
Mix gently until colors are uniform.
Pour each colored batter into prepared pans.
Bake at 175°C (350°F) for 12–15 mins or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool layers in pans for 5 mins, then transfer to wire racks.
Beat heavy cream, powdered sugar, and vanilla extract until soft peaks form.
Place Red layer on serving plate. Spread a thin layer of frosting.
Continue layering Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, and Purple layers with frosting in between.
Frost the top and sides of the cake evenly.
Serving: Slice and serve to reveal vibrant rainbow layers.

name: Dark Chocolate
details: Powdered sugar – ½ cup (adjust to taste)
stepDetails: Chop cocoa butter into small pieces.
Melt it gently in a double boiler over low heat.
Sift cocoa powder to remove lumps.
Add powdered sugar and a pinch of salt to melted cocoa butter.
Stir continuously until smooth and glossy.
Add vanilla extract and mix well.
Pour mixture into silicone or lined molds.
Tap lightly to remove air bubbles.
Serving: Refrigerate until firm.

name: White Chocolate
details: Powdered sugar – ½ cup (adjust to taste)
steps: Step 2:  Mix Sugar & Milk Powder (2–3 mins):
stepDetails: Chop cocoa butter into small pieces.
Melt gently in a double boiler over low heat.
Sift powdered sugar and milk powder together to remove lumps.
Gradually add sugar-milk mixture into melted cocoa butter.
Stir continuously until smooth and glossy.
Add vanilla extract and mix well.
Pour mixture into silicone or lined molds.
Tap lightly to remove air bubbles.
Serving: Pop out chocolates from molds once fully set.

name: Fruits & Nuts Chocolate
details: Mixed nuts – ½ cup (almonds, cashews, pistachios, walnuts)
Dried fruits – ½ cup (raisins, cranberries, apricots, figs, or mix)
Coconut oil / butter – 1 tbsp (optional, for smoothness & shine)
stepDetails: Roughly chop nuts and dried fruits.
Lightly toast nuts in a dry pan (4–5 mins) until fragrant.
Set aside to cool.
Chop chocolate into small pieces.
Melt gently in a double boiler or microwave (30-sec bursts).
Stir until smooth and glossy.
Add coconut oil/butter if using.
Mix half of the toasted nuts and fruits into the melted chocolate.
Stir well to coat evenly.
Line a tray with parchment or use silicone molds.
Pour chocolate mixture in.
Sprinkle the remaining fruits and nuts on top.
Tap lightly to remove air bubbles.
Serving: Refrigerate until firm and set.

name: Rasgulla sweets
details: Lemon juice / vinegar – 2 tbsp (diluted in 2 tbsp water)
Ice-cold water – ¼ cup (for washing curds)
stepDetails: Boil milk in a heavy-bottom pan over medium heat (8–10 min).
Once boiling, add lemon juice/vinegar gradually while stirring gently. Milk curdles.
Turn off heat, let it sit 2 min.
Strain curds using a muslin cloth. Rinse under cold water to remove acidity (2–3 min).
Squeeze out excess water and hang for 15–20 min to drain completely.
Transfer chhena to a flat surface.
Knead with palm until smooth and soft (no lumps).
Optional: add a pinch of semolina or flour to bind slightly if needed.
Roll gently into smooth, crack-free balls.
In a wide pan, combine sugar and water.
Boil until sugar dissolves completely. Add crushed cardamom.
Ensure syrup has enough space for balls to expand.
Gently add balls into boiling syrup.
Cover pan with lid and cook on medium heat for 15–18 min.
Rasgullas will double in size and become spongy.
Stir gently once midway to prevent sticking.
Serving: Add rose water if desired.

name: Gulab Jamun sweets
details: Milk – 2–3 tbsp (as needed to form dough)
stepDetails: Combine sugar and water in a pan.
Boil until sugar dissolves completely.
Add crushed cardamom, saffron, and rose water (optional).
Keep warm on very low flame.
In a bowl, mix grated khoya and flour.
Add milk gradually to form a soft, smooth, non-sticky dough.
Do not over-knead; just enough to bind.
Divide dough into small portions (~15–20 g each).
Roll gently into smooth, crack-free balls
Keep small; they expand while frying.
Heat ghee/oil in a deep pan over medium-low flame.
Fry the balls gently, stirring continuously, until golden brown on all sides.
Remove with slotted spoon and drain on paper towel briefly.
Immediately transfer warm Gulab Jamuns into warm sugar syrup.
Let them soak for at least 15–20 min to absorb syrup fully.
Serving: Can garnish with chopped nuts.

name: Ladoo sweets
stepDetails: Heat ghee in a heavy-bottom pan on low flame.
Add besan gradually, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
Roast until the mixture turns golden brown and aromatic (10–12 min).
Remove from heat and let the roasted besan mixture cool slightly (warm, not hot).
Add powdered sugar and cardamom powder.
Mix thoroughly until smooth and uniform.
Add chopped nuts if using.
Take small portions of the mixture in your palm.
Roll into smooth, round balls (about the size of a walnut).
Repeat with the remaining mixture.
Serving: Store in an airtight container for up to 1–2 weeks.

name: Jalebi sweets
details: Water – ⅓ cup (adjust for batter consistency)
A pinch of baking soda or eno fruit salt – ¼ tsp
Saffron strands – a few (optional, for color)
steps: Step 4:  Fry Jalebis – 10–12 min per batch
Step 5:  Soak in Sugar Syrup – 5 min
stepDetails: In a bowl, mix flour and yogurt.
Add water gradually to form a smooth, slightly thick batter (like pancake batter).
Cover and let it ferment at room temperature for 6–8 hours (or overnight) for soft Jalebis.
Combine sugar and water in a pan, bring to boil.
Add crushed cardamom and lemon juice.
Boil until slightly sticky (one-string consistency).
Add rose water and keep warm.
Heat ghee/oil on medium flame for frying.
Pour batter into a piping bag or squeeze bottle.
Squeeze spirals directly into hot oil, forming circles or pretzel-like shapes.
Fry until crisp and golden on both sides.
Remove and drain excess oil on paper towels.
Serving: Immediately dip fried Jalebis in warm sugar syrup for 2–3 min.

name: Coconut Barfi sweets
details: Fresh grated coconut – 2 cups (or desiccated coconut – 2 cups)
Chopped nuts (cashews, almonds) – 2 tbsp (optional, for garnish)
stepDetails: Grease a plate or tray with 1 tsp ghee and keep aside.
Measure all ingredients.
In a non-stick pan, add grated coconut, sugar, and milk.
Cook on medium flame, stirring continuously to prevent sticking.
Cook until mixture thickens and starts leaving the sides of the pan (~10–12 min).
Add cardamom powder and mix well.
Add 1 tsp ghee for shine (optional).
Pour the mixture into the greased tray.
Flatten evenly using a spatula.
Sprinkle chopped nuts on top and press lightly.

name: Mysore Pak sweets
stepDetails: In a pan, combine sugar and water.
Boil until sugar dissolves completely and syrup reaches one-string consistency.
Keep warm on low flame.
Lightly roast besan in a dry pan for 2–3 min on low flame to remove raw smell.
Do not brown; keep it pale.
Gradually add roasted besan to the hot sugar syrup while stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
Mix well to form a smooth, thick batter.
Add ghee slowly in small portions while stirring.
Cook on low-medium flame, stirring continuously.
Batter will start leaving the sides and become frothy.
Add cardamom powder (optional) and mix gently.
Grease a plate or tray with ghee.
Pour the hot mixture into the tray and spread evenly.
Allow to cool slightly (still warm) and cut into squares or rectangles using a greased knife.
Serving: Let Mysore Pak cool completely to firm up before serving or storing.
